Boston bombing suspect remains at large; manhunt in city continues

(Charles Krupa/ AP photo)
Police patrolled through a neighborhood in Watertown, while searching for a suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings. All residents of Boston were ordered to stay in their homes as the search continued.
Photos of bombing suspects | FBI video of suspects | Surveillance footage

Hunt for bomb suspect focuses on Watertown

Heavily armed police are searching for Dzhokhor Tsarnaev, 19. (12:31 p.m.)

Relatives worried about brother's influence

A relative of the suspects said he repeatedly warned the 19-year-old fugitive about the bad influence of his older brother. (3:26 p.m.)

Pictures: Latest scenes from the manhunt

Members of a SWAT team walked down Nichols Avenue in Watertown earlier today. David L. Ryan / Globe Staff
This eerily empty street would normally be bustling near Faneuil Hall and City Hall in Boston, but the city is locked down. Reuters Photo
Ruslan Tsarni, the uncle of bombing suspects Dzhokhar and Tamerlan Tsarnaev, spoke outside his home in Maryland. AP Photo
Dzhokhar A. Tsarnaev is seen in this law enforcement bulletin distributed by the Boston Regional Intelligence Center.
SWAT teams moved into position at the intersection in Watertown while searching for suspect #2. Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe
A police officer took position during a search for the Boston Marathon bombing suspect in Watertown. Brian Synder/Reuters
SWAT teams entered a Watertown neighborhood to search an apartment for the remaining suspect. Jessica Rinaldi / Reuters Photo
Police searched for one remaining suspect at an apartment building where a resident reported finding drops of blood. Mario Tama/Getty Images
Residents of an apartment building watched as law enforcement agencies surveyed the home of suspect #2. Jared Wickerham/Getty Images
A man looked out of his door as a SWAT team member knocked on his neighbor's door. Jessica Rinaldi/ Reuters Photo
Governor Patrick addressed members of the media during a press conference at the Watertown Mall. Essdras m Suarez/ Globe Staff
SWAT teams moved into position on a street in Watertown while searching for the suspect. Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe
"Live on the Watertown/Belmont border. Heard the gun fire last night. The helicopters are flying directly over our house every 30-45 seconds. -- Jeffry from Belmont

Live Blog: Boston bombing updates

    • Read all of the live updates

    What you need to know right now

    • Tonight's Red Sox-Royals game postponed
    • Bruin-Penguins game tonight also postponed
    • State: People at work are free to drive home
    • Taxi service has been restored in Boston
    • Several courts are closed due to search
    • MBTA service suspended, buses halted
    • Many businesses close their offices
    • Boston hospitals are in lockdown
    • Vehicle traffic in and out of Watertown is suspended
    • People in Boston-area are under orders to stay indoors and keep businesses closed
    • Many Boston colleges and universities are closed
    • The MFA, Boston Children's Museum, and Museum of Science are closed

    Boston lockdown

    Streets around Boston are empty as the area hunkers down and police hunt down the bombing suspect.
